alert.note: Alert for Curry County; Quay County; Roosevelt County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 24 at 7:27PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTH CENTRAL ROOSEVELT... SOUTHEASTERN QUAY AND CURRY COUNTIES THROUGH 800 PM MDT... At 727 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 14 miles southeast of Ragland to 8 miles south of Melrose. Movement was northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Melrose, Grady, Saint Vrain, Cannon Air Force Base, Ranchvale, Broadview, Wheatland, Portair, and Forrest. This includes Highway 60 between Mile Markers 357 and 383. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area.

area.areaDesc: Curry County; Quay County; Roosevelt County
